project_abstract.cdata: This project paper seeks the approval of the Empowerment in Rural Areas Project (EAP) Regional Vice President to provide an additional grant in the amount of US$10.2 million to Indonesia's Third National Program for Community Empowerment in Rural Areas (PNPM-Rural). This grant will help finance the costs of expanding the geographical coverage of a pilot project implemented under PNPM-Rural, entitled PNPM Generasi Sehat dan Cerdas (PNPM Generasi) or the National Program for Community Empowerment - a healthy and smart generation. Since 2007, the pilot has been operating in five provinces and 164 sub-districts of Indonesia as part of PNPM-Rural, and has been performing fully satisfactorily. The additional grant of US$10.2 million from the PNPM Support Facility (PSF) will add 48 sub-districts in West Nusa Tenggara province to the PNPM Generasi program. This US$10.2 million grant is the first installment of a pledged US$105 million (A$ 125 million) over five years from PSF to expand PNPM Generasi. Expected outcomes will be improved education and health indicators in the form of primary and junior secondary school enrollment and attendance, and infant and maternal healthcare.
